properties.Title: Update: Sasktel Service Outage In Macklin, Senlac, And The Surrounding Areas
properties.Summary:
Description: UPDATE: SaskTel crews have arrived on site and are beginning work to repair the cut cable. However, due to the complex and time-consuming nature of the work involved it will likely take several hours before all SaskTel services are restored in Macklin, Senlac, and the surrounding areas.
Expires: 2019-06-11T23:45:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK SaskTel, 2019-06-10T17:24:19-06:00, A7C48D1C-F84D-033B-8C50-CECB4B707208
Area: Town of Macklin and Village of Senlac
properties.Author: SK SaskTel

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong easterly winds with gusts up to 100 km/h will continue at Grise Fiord. Winds are expected to weaken near noon. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-11T21:59:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-11T15:06:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3077874644.2019
Area: Grise Fiord
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Cancelled
properties.Summary:
Description: The emergency alert is being cancelled but there are still wildfires in the area and everyone in Peerless Trout First Nation must continue to monitor the community Facebook page and website regarding these fires. ### Peerless Trout First Nation website is www.ptfn.net and www.facebook.com/peerlesstroutfirstnation/ is the Facebook page for this community. Additional Wildfire information is also available at www.wildfire.alberta.ca website. Check https://511.alberta.ca/#:Alerts for more information on roadway information.
Expires: 2019-06-18T12:28:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Peerless Trout First Nation, 2019-06-11T12:26:25-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5836
Area: Peerless Lake First Nation
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Peerless Trout First Nation

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For The Northern Village Of Ile-A-La Crosse.
properties.Summary:
Description: Due to the continued upgrades at the Water Treatment Plant, a Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory remains in affect for Northern Village of Ile-a-la Crosse. This advisory is for the Northern Village of Ile-a-la Crosse and for any individuals who may access water the Ile-a-la Crosse water system. This advisory is in effect until the water is deemed completed safe.
Expires: 2019-06-18T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Ile a la Crosse, 2019-06-11T09:25:40-06:00, ABCDC548-47C5-6912-D2B9-03FE44F52B74
Area: Northern Village of Ile-a-la Crosse
properties.Author: SK Ile a la Crosse

properties.Title: Update For The Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Issued For The Town Of Rosthern.
properties.Summary:
Description: Update for the Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory that was issued for the Town of Rosthern. As of Monday, June 10th, the advisory is still in effect and will remain in place until further notice.
Expires: 2019-06-12T12:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Rosthern, 2019-06-10T11:21:05-06:00, 6B1D0A40-1487-2DA9-D9E5-E4473995066B
Area: Town of Rosthern
properties.Author: SK Rosthern

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, heavy at times is expected. The frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb this rainfall. Rainfall with total amounts of 25 mm is expected to fall in Grise Fiord today. The rainfall is expected to end late this afternoon. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-12T04:16:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-11T15:06:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0324240947.2019
Area: Grise Fiord
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High levels of air pollution and deteriorated air quality are expected due to smoke from forest fires west of Gogama. Air quality may deteriorate further if the smoke descends to ground level. If you, or someone in your care, develop symptoms, reduce or reschedule strenuous outdoors activities where ever possible until the air quality improves. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-12T12:07:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario, 2019-06-11T20:08:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0365523543.2019
Area: Gogama - Foleyet
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 3:49 p.m. CDT (3:49 p.m. EST, 4:49 p.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts and up to nickel size hail. This severe thunderstorm is located near Lac la Croix, moving east at 40 km/h. Locations impacted include: Lac la Croix and Quetico Provincial Park. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-06-11T23:48:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-11T20:50:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3153082906.2019
Area: Seine River Village - Mine Centre, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wildfire smoke is causing locally poor air quality and reduced visibility. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-12T08:47:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-06-11T16:48:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0568118706.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning Ended
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms have weakened or moved out of the region. ###
Expires: 2019-06-11T21:17:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-11T20:17:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1037794778.2019
Area: Fort Frances - Emo - Rainy River, Seine River Village - Mine Centre
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. Thunderstorms are expected to develop this afternoon. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-06-12T02:14:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-11T18:20:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1984574957.2019
Area: Fort Frances - Emo - Rainy River, Seine River Village - Mine Centre, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada
